abstract: The electronics manufacturer, which supplies Apple, Hewlett-Packard and other technology giants, previously said it would raise wages 20 percent.
snippet: The electronics manufacturer, which supplies Apple, Hewlett-Packard and other technology giants, previously said it would raise wages 20 percent.
lead_paragraph: The Foxconn Technology Group, a giant contract electronics manufacturer that experienced a series of worker suicides, said it would raise salaries by at least 30 percent, more than previously indicated.

abstract: At a technology conference, Mr. Jobs pours cold water on rumors that Apple will do away with Google’s search products or that it will soon revamp its ailing Apple TV product.
snippet: At a technology conference, Mr. Jobs pours cold water on rumors that Apple will do away with Google’s search products or that it will soon revamp its ailing Apple TV product.
lead_paragraph: For Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive of Apple, the timing of his public appearance at the D8 conference could not have been better. Last week, Apple surpassed Microsoft to become the world’s most valuable technology company. A little more than a decade ago, Apple was struggling for its life, and many tech pundits were predicting its demise.

headline.main: Steve Jobs Muses on All Things Apple

abstract: Steven P. Jobs said he planned to build a tablet computer before he decided to push Apple into the smart phone business.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs said he planned to build a tablet computer before he decided to push Apple into the smart phone business.
lead_paragraph: Apple first released the iPhone in 2007, about three years before it came out with the iPad.

headline.main: First Came the Idea for a Tablet, Jobs Says
